Class Soccer

java.lang.Object
Game
Soccer
public class Soccer
extends Game
This class is used to implement a game of Soccer. It is a subclass of the Game class, and thus it defines the two abstract methods from Game. It also includes a two-argument constructor that makes a call to the super-class constructor.
Since:
10/3/2021
Author:
Tucker Dickson

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Soccer​(Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam)
    This is the sole constructor for the Soccer class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Soccer

      public Soccer​(Team homeTeam, Team awayTeam)
      This is the sole constructor for the Soccer class. It takes in two parameters, Team objects homeTeam and awayTeam, and then passes those two Teams, along with the int 45 and the String "half" to the super-class constructor.
      Parameters:
      homeTeam - This Team object refers to the home team in the game, and it will be used to set Game's homeTeam private instance variable.
      awayTeam - This Team object refers to the away team in the game, and it will be used to set Game's awayTeam private instance variable.

  • Method Details

    • getScoringMethods

      public ScoringMethod[] getScoringMethods()
      This method is the Soccer class's overridden version of the Game class's abstract getScoringMethods() method. It doesn't take any parameters, but it returns an array of ScoringMethod objects, each of which represents a scoring method in Soccer.
      Specified by:
      getScoringMethods in class Game
      Returns:
      This method returns an array of ScoringMethod objects, each of which represents a scoring method in the game of soccer (in this case, a goal is the only scoring method).

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      This method is the Soccer class's overridden version of the Game class's abstract isGameOver() method. This method takes in no parameters, but it returns a boolean value indicating whether or not a soccer game is over.
      Specified by:
      isGameOver in class Game
      Returns:
      This method returns a boolean value indicating whether or not a soccer game is over (true means the game is over).
